Text:
On the instructions i wrote step 1 two times... 
Sry, just skip step 1....
To install it asks for serial number, that's all it took and it worked.  No need to add that other stuff.
I would recommend you to add them, cause your serial might get blocked....

i dont understand how to install:

so when i run the install file to i install as trail or enter a serial?

and i dont understand the open terminal part

help?
Tx, it worked perfectly

My Sudo isn't working.
it says: WARNING: Improper use of the sudo command could lead to a data loss or the deletion of important system files. Please double-check your typing when using sudo.

and don't let me write the password. Can you help me?

shaquash, heres what to do:
open terminal.
type
login root
and hit enter. it will ask for password, but when you type your password will not appear. that is normal, it is registering the password, it just isnt showing it. type it anyways, making sure it is corrent, and hit enter again. now do everything he said and it will work.
works great thanks for seeding

Don't know how to do the Activation Blocker. When I open the terminal application I did not find any text that said 127.0.0.1 localhost and 255.255.255.255  broadcasthost. When I attempt to paste the info provided it does not let me paste everything. It stops at the finale adobe without .com part. 
Please help!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Let me be more specific about the problem. We opened terminal app and did the login root thing and the password. We then pasted the  sudo /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts sentence, as specified. I pressed enter. Correct? Or not. That's not specified. What happened then was a host file came up with a couple lines exactly as was mentioned about the 127.0.0.1 localhost and 255.255.255.255 
    broadcasthost. I copied the stuff to paste between those two lines. When I went to paste it it wouldn't accept the paste. You can type in the file by hand, but, you can't paste anything there. I tried copying from the host file back into the initial terminal app file and nothing could be copied. The host file info would not copy. What am I missing? I feel like we're almost there. Thank you.
Downloads as of today

kcmorgain, your problem seems to be a text encoding notation problem. other than that you have done everything right. to remedy this open up the file to copy, and then press command+shift+t this will make it plain text. now it should accept your copy paste. let me know if this works.

4n0n8m0u5, Thank you for responding to me. So I wasn't sure if I should try to paste in the file opens up after I paste  sudo /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts or the Terminal app. I did both. I first copied the text, then in the file that had the localhost and broadcasthost info did command+shift+t and a message came up saying "localhost is used to configure the loopback interface when the system is booting. Do not change this entry. I went on to paste anyway and nothing happened. Next I copied the text, then did the command+shift+t in the Terminal app, then I pasted. I had the same problem of not being able to paste all the text that was pasted. Do you have any other suggestions. Am I doing something wrong?

I just realized your instructions are to do the command+shift+t in file I am copying. I just did that it asked if I wanted to change to plain text. I answered yes then tried to paste into the host file and the Terminal app and still no luck.
That sucks. Its not a big deal. i torrent loads and have never got a serial blocked. Just launch the app normally.

Sorry, I'm new to this so I'm a little bit confused about the instructions. I copied the sudo into the Terminal but am now being prompted for a password. What should this be?

the password is the password you use for your own user :) 

If you got no password, then you just press enter.

Good Luck! :)
As usual, it works :) loove your stuff thanks man
I have DW CS3 already installed. When I open CS5 to install it opens my CS3. Where should I go from there? Thanks.

Thanks for upload, it seems to  work fine. I was asked to install the serial immediately I tried to install. Instead, I followed the instructions and pasted the code, put in my password, saved the text file that pops up and then ran the flush code given. I then went through the installation process using the serial given inside. I restarted the mac and it seemed to work fine, not asking for anymore serials.

thanks!

After updating to OSX Lion the Adobe invalid serial pop up came up again. The previous announced procedure to block the activation process is not valid anymore on this new update. The following steps worked fine with me, but I had to change the serial since it never worked back again:

Adobe CS5 Serial (Mac)
sn: 

1325-0150-1163-7532-1626-3430 
1325-0178-1927-9019-0123-2254 
1325-0702-3693-1544-9166-3515 
1325-0549-2240-0071-3409-1342 

Edit your Host's file to block the verification process in CS5: 

Open a Terminal and type: 

sudo nano /private/etc/hosts 

Then Copy & Paste this lines: 

127.0.0.1 activate.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 ereg.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 activate.wip3.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 wip3.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 3dns-3.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 3dns-2.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-2.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-3.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 ereg.wip3.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 activate-sea.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 activate-sjc0.adobe.com 
127.0.0.1 adobe.activate.com 
127.0.0.1 209.34.83.73:443 
127.0.0.1 209.34.83.73:43 
127.0.0.1 209.34.83.73 
127.0.0.1 209.34.83.67:443 
127.0.0.1 209.34.83.67:43 
127.0.0.1 209.34.83.67 
127.0.0.1 ood.opsource.net 
127.0.0.1 CRL.VERISIGN.NET 
127.0.0.1 199.7.52.190:80 
127.0.0.1 199.7.52.190 
127.0.0.1 adobeereg.com 
127.0.0.1 OCSP.SPO1.VERISIGN.COM 
127.0.0.1 199.7.54.72:80 
127.0.0.1 199.7.54.72 

Save with CONTROL + X 

Get back to terminal and type: 

dscacheutil -flushcache

Here's how to change the hosts file in Lion: http://appzdev.com/mac-iphone-blog/2011/07/how-to-edit-the-hosts-file-in-mac-os-x-leopardlion/
thanks :)

10.7.2 users: 

Download a free program called 'Little Snitch'. Don't worry about the hosts file, you won't need to change it in the way noted in the torrent. Make sure Little Snitch is running. Install Dreamweaver as normal, when prompted for a serial during installation enter one of those provided with the torrent. Let it install, and run the program. (don't fart around with hosts...)

Little Snitch will then report that the software is trying to access adobe's activation servers. click 'forever' and 'deny'. Enjoy.

Cyberpiraten!! You know you the man!! Thanks a bunch as always! However: one question...

I have the cs5.5 production pack running - no dreamweaver (also yours i thinks). Will this install fuck up something with with the production pack ??

I just don't feel like uninstalling a setup that works like a charm and setting up a master collection. So just need this as an addition, to my productionpack. Any suggestions?

Thanks again dude, you really make a difference for loads of peeps!

i have 10.7.2 Lion.. Did exactly what triley said and downloaded 'little snitch'.. hit 'forever - deny' and it seems to work perfectly!  way easier than trying to figure out editing all that host stuff...  now i just have to figure out how to use the program!  
Thanks so much!

Hello, 

Thank you very much for the upload. 
OS Lion, it really works. 

I did in that way: 
1. Download torrent
2. Istall small app called Little Snitch. 

*before installation, please be sure that the Little Snitch is running!!!!*
3. Start Dreamweaver Installation.
4. Select full version and use CD keys suggest in the  torrent.
5. During installation the DW would like to connect to the Internet. Please DENY FOREVER all the connections using the Little Snitch. 
6. When th installation is done, you can start program and enjoy it:)


PS. I dont understand "geeks" who spend there time to install professional programs like DW and dont even know how to use it (see post above*)

Good luck to any1.

Regards, Debaucep.

In case of question/suggestions, please mail me on Debaucep@yandex.ru
